creator: calestyo@scientia.net
text:
In the mod_rewrite documentation, the RewriteRule description says:
>On the first RewriteRule it is applied to the
>(%-encoded) URL-path of the request;

Shouldn't this read:
"...(%-decoded)..." (i.e. one doesn't match URL containting: "/spa%20ce/" but "/spa ce"?
?

Then it would also better fit the description of the B flag, where it's correctly used, AFAIU.


Cheers,
Chris.
